intro: Cyclosorus usitatus, commonly known as the common cyclosorus, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its submerged, branching stems and whorled arrangement of narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically borne in clusters near the water surface. Cyclosorus usitatus is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and lakes. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates.
